intro: Steironema pumilum var. longipedicellatum, commonly known as the long-armed steironema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. This variant is distinguished by its elongated pedicels, which give it its specific epithet "longipedicellatum."
